intro: Pimela, commonly known as the African water lily, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Nymphaeaceae and is characterized by its broad, floating leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats, such as ponds and lakes. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The plant plays an important ecological role by providing habitat for aquatic organisms and contributing to water filtration.
